results.title: Encaustic by Karl Zerbe
results.brief_description: This film explains that encaustic - hot wax used as a binder for pigment - is an ancient painting technique revised by Karl Zerbe in the late 1930’s. Follows the artist in the various steps from the laying of a collage ground on bare masonite through the final touches of blowtorch to the surface of the finished painting.

results.title: Enameling art
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Robert Longini
results.brief_description: Indicates the basic practices common to this medium. Shows students at work enamelling on copper, with close-ups to demonstrate specific techniques.

results.title: En Toute Innocence = No Harm Intended
results.brief_description:
Paul Duchene runs an architecture practice with his son Thomas and Thomas’ wife, Catherine. One day, Paul finds Catherine in the arms of one of his assistants. Seething with rage, he drives off in his car and has an accident that leaves him crippled and mute. Failing a reconciliation, his daughter-in-law plans his murder.

Credits: Producer, Louis Duchesne ; director, Alain Jessua ; writers, Luc Beraud, Alain Jessua, Dominique Roulet ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Michel Portal.
Cast: Michel Serrault, Nathalie Baye, Francois Dunoyer, Suzanne Flon, Philippe Caroit.

results.title: En roulant ma boule. A la claire fontaine.
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, Jim MacKay, Cine-Photographie and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Chants populaires”.
Animated scenes illustrate two French folk songs. ‘En roulant ma boule’ 2.50 mins. ‘A la claire fontaine’ 1.39 mins. Featuring the Alouette Quartet.

results.title: En Normandie
results.brief_description: One of a series of teaching films with commentary in simple French. Illustrates the farm life of the province and then by contrast shows the industrial life concluding with several views of the two large ports, Rouen and Le Havre.

results.title: Emus: curious companions. Echidna: the survivor
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), National Geographic Society, Piper Films, Richard Campbell, Mike Piper and Jim Roberts
results.brief_description: Two separate episodes examine two of Austalia’s best-loved animals, the emu and the echidna. ‘Emu - curious companions’ follows the work of researcher Cate Coddington. Her study of one of Australia’s most recognisable birds involved following a group of emus through a cold Canberra winter. In the process she discovered startling information about their breeding habits and social systems. ‘Echidna - the survivor’, filmed on Kangaroo Island, South Australia, presents one of Australia’s least-known mammals, through the work of researchers Dr. Peggy Rismiller and Mike McKelvey.

results.title: Emu Spew
results.creator_credit: Pip Starr, SKA TV and Campbell Manderson
results.brief_description: Report on the efforts of the Adnyamathanha people, traditional landowners of the Northern Flinders Rangers to stop the Beverly Uranium Mining Project. The report also covers police action against the protestors and the unsafe method the mining company are using to extract the uranium. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.
